title.value: The Case for Globalizing Fairness: A Mixed Methods Study on Colonialism, AI, and Health in Africa
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the research paper.
title.quote: The Case for Globalizing Fairness: A Mixed Methods Study on Colonialism, AI, and Health in Africa

extractions.description: The paper explores fairness in the development of machine learning models for health applications in Africa. It conducts a scoping review to propose axes of disparities and performs qualitative research with general population and experts to validate these axes, focusing on colonialism as a major attribute.

type.justification: The paper involves qualitative research involving surveys and interviews with general population participants and experts.
type.quote: We conduct a qualitative study with 672 general population participants and 28 experts participants across several African countries to validate their relevance.

name.justification: The core focus of the paper is on fairness in the development and deployment of ML models in the context of African healthcare.
name.quote: This work lays a foundation for contextualizing fairness beyond western contexts using machine learning applications to health in Africa as a case study.

name.justification: The application domain discussed in the paper is the use of AI in healthcare, specifically in Africa.
name.quote: Machine learning (ML) models have the potential for far reaching impact in health.

name.justification: The paper deals with the responsible development and deployment of AI technologies considering historical and social contexts.
name.quote: Insights from these findings serve to better understand structural challenges to developing and deploying ML-based solutions for health in Africa as well as provide practical recommendations.
